toolkit.name: com.ibm.streamsx.redis
toolkit.description: The IBM streams toolkit streamsx.redis uses JEDIS JAR libaries to connect to the REDIS database.

parameter.name: vmArg
parameter.description: Specifies command-line arguments that are passed to the Java virtual machine that the operator runs within.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: This optional parameter specifies the connection timeout for REDIS database. The client will wait for n seconds to get an valid connection. If the connectionTimeout parameter is specified, it must have exactly one value of type INT32 grater than zero.

parameter.name: keyAttr
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of `key` attribute that coming through input stream.

parameter.name: redisKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name REDIS key

parameter.name: redisPassword
parameter.description: This optional parameter specifies the password of REDIS database. If the redisPassword parameter is specified, it must have exactly one value of type rstring.. This parameter can be overwritten by the **credentials**.

parameter.name: redisUrl
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the database url that REDIS client uses to connect to a database and it must have exactly one value of type rstring. The syntax of redis url is specified by database vendors. For example, redis://<server>:<port> .
**server**, the domain name or IP address of the REDIS database.
**port**, the TCP/IP server port number that is assigned to the REDIS port.
This parameter can be overwritten by the **credentials**.

parameter.name: valueAttr
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of `value attribute' that coming through input stream.

primitiveOp.name: RedisGet
primitiveOp.description:
The **RedisGet** operator reads the value of key from REDIS database.
This operator get tuples 'keyAttr' that arrive on its input port

parameter.name: vmArg
parameter.description: Specifies command-line arguments that are passed to the Java virtual machine that the operator runs within.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: This optional parameter specifies the connection timeout for REDIS database. The client will wait for n seconds to get an valid connection. If the connectionTimeout parameter is specified, it must have exactly one value of type INT32 grater than zero.

parameter.name: keyAttr
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of `key` attribute that coming through input stream.

parameter.name: redisKey
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name REDIS key

parameter.name: redisPassword
parameter.description: This optional parameter specifies the password of REDIS database. If the redisPassword parameter is specified, it must have exactly one value of type rstring.. This parameter can be overwritten by the **credentials**.

parameter.name: redisUrl
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the database url that REDIS client uses to connect to a database and it must have exactly one value of type rstring. The syntax of redis url is specified by database vendors. For example, redis://<server>:<port> .
**server**, the domain name or IP address of the REDIS database.

This parameter can be overwritten by the **credentials**.

parameter.name: valueAttr
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the name of `value attribute' that coming through input stream.

primitiveOp.name: RedisSet
primitiveOp.description:
The **RedisSet** operator writes key value pairs into REDIS database.
This operator writes tuples 'keyAttr' and 'valueAttr' that arrive on its input port
